title: A radio loud semiregular variable
authors: Pedro L. Luque-Escamilla and Josep Mart\'i
abstract:
As a byproduct of our search for Galactic stellar systems with gamma-ray
emission, we have identified an unrelated cool and evolved star (IRC-10412)
that attracted our attention due to its strong radio emission level with a
spectral index matching, almost perfectly, the canonical +0.6 value expected
from an ionized stellar wind. A follow-up observational analysis was undertaken
given that these two properties are hard to reconcile as originating in the
same stellar object. As a result, IRC-10412 has been classified as a new
semiregular variable of SRb type in the asymptotic giant branch, and different
but consistent estimates of its mass-loss parameter are reported. We propose
that its unusually high radio emission arises from a ~ 1E-5 Msun/yr stellar
wind exposed to an external source of ionizing photons, possibly coming from
nearby OB associations.
